thread.title: Wheaties drop first two games of season
thread.title_full: Wheaties drop first two games of season

title: Wheaties drop first two games of season
text:
Wheaties drop first two games of season By: Uncredited PERRY BERGSON/BRANDON SUN Enlarge Image 
Winnipeg Thrashers netminder Dylan Myskiw prepares to make a save as Brandon Midget AAA Wheat Kings’ Carson Ransom tries to corral the puck on Saturday evening during their Manitoba AAA Midget Hockey League game at the Sportsplex. Thrashers defenceman Bronson Kelly can be seen at left getting back into the play. The Thrashers won 5-1. 
The Brandon Wheat Kings are off to a rough start in the Manitoba AAA Midget Hockey League after dropping their first two games of the season on the weekend. 
Carson Ransom scored an unassisted goal on Sunday in Portage la Prairie as the Wheat Kings (0-2-0) fell 2-0 to the host Central Plains Capitals (2-0-0). Max Paddock made 28 saves in his debut in net for Brandon. Marco Mazza, Jayson Brooks and Jared Roy scored for Central Plains. 
Elsewhere on Sunday, it was: Eastman Selects 5, Yellowhead Chiefs 2. 
In Saturday’s games, it was: Winnipeg Wild 3, Southwest Cougars 2 in a shootout; Kenora Thistles 3, Chiefs 2 in a shootout; and Winnipeg Thrashers 5, Wheat Kings 1. 
Selects 5 Chiefs 2 
At Beausejour, Ryan Heino and Benoit Mowbray scored the goals for Yellowhead (0-1-2), which managed 11 shots on goal in its third game in three days. Reece Jones made 36 saves in net. Brad Goethals and Braeden Binda had a goal and an assist for the Selects (2-0-0). 
Wild 3 Cougars 2 (SO) 
At Souris, Zach Wytinck and John Patmore scored for the Cougars (1-0-1). Rylan Rommelaere stopped 29 shots in regulation and overtime but was beaten twice by Ian Briscoe of Winnipeg (2-0-0) in the shootout, which went four shooters per side. 
Thistles 3 Chiefs 2 (SO) 
In Kenora, Ryan Heino scored in the third period to force extra time, but the Chiefs dropped their second straight game in a shootout to the Thistles (2-0-1). Jacob Tibbatts netted Yellowhead’s other marker, while Riley Lamb made 26 saves in regulation and overtime. 
Thrashers 5 Wheat Kings 1 
At the Sportsplex, Brandon’s Tate Popple scored with four minutes left to break up the shutout bid for the Thrashers (2-0-0), who got two goals and two helpers from Riley Bruce. Josh Petersen stopped 21 shots for the Wheaties. 
» The Brandon Sun
